meanings.definition: Aether: a hypothetical medium formerly believed to fill all space and to support the propagation of electromagnetic waves
meanings.sent1: Scientists once thought aether was like an invisible blanket covering everything.
meanings.sent2: The concept of aether helped explain how light traveled through space.
meanings.sent3: When the magician waved his wand, he claimed to summon aether to perform his tricks.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was like aether, surrounding her with warmth and comfort.
meanings.sent5: In the story, the hero ventured into the aether to discover hidden secrets of the universe.

meanings.definition: Aether: the clear sky; the upper regions of air beyond the clouds
meanings.sent1: The pilot gazed at the vast aether above, feeling free as a bird.
meanings.sent2: The birds soared gracefully through the aether, their wings catching the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The children imagined dragons flying high in the aether, breathing fire.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams floated like clouds in the aether, ever-changing and beautiful.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the colors of the aether painted the sky in shades of pink and orange.
